byline.contributor: Jia Guo and Jeffrey E. Singer contributed reporting.

abstract: Indictment of New York City Police Officer Peter Liang in shooting death of unarmed black man Akai Gurley has divided city's Chinese-American community; incident, along with murder of Police Officer Wenjian Liu, has thrust community into America's fraught politics of fatal police encounters; many in community feel Liang is being made a scapegoat following outrage over deaths of black men like Michael Brown.
lead_paragraph: The filing of manslaughter charges against Officer Peter Liang in the shooting death of an unarmed black man has pulled Chinese-Americans into a politically charged debate.

headline.main: Indictment of New York Officer Divides Chinese-Americans
headline.print_headline: In City, Indictment of an Officer Divides Chinese-Americans

snippet: The filing of manslaughter charges against Officer Peter Liang in the shooting death of an unarmed black man has pulled Chinese-Americans into a politically charged debate.
